question:
(a) Highlight any three effects of either rotation or revolution of the earth

(b) Give reasons why:
(i) all areas north of the Arctic Circle have twenty four hours of daylight on June 21
(ii) areas within the tropics have more sunshine than areas outside the tropics
answer:
(a) Three effects of rotation of the earth include:

(i) It causes day and night

(ii) It causes the deflection of winds and ocean currents

(iii) It causes the rising and falling of the tides.

(b)(i) Reasons why all areas north of the Arctic cycle have 24 hours of daylight on June 21:

(i) The sun appears to move northwards on June 21

(ii) Daylight increases as one goes towards the north pole.

(iii) The sun never sets at mid-summer (nature of season)

(iv) The earth is inclined to the plane of the ecliptic which causes the variation in length of daylights.

(b)(ii) Reasons why areas within the tropics have more sunshine than areas outside the tropics

(i) The sun is always overhead at the tropics

(ii) It represents the centre of the earth

(iii) It is the region which only experiences equal day and night (equinoxes)

(iv) There is variation in length of day and night towards the poles.

question:
(a) Using appropriate diagrams, explain the process of formation of a
(i) river capture
(ii) waterfall

(b) Describe one way in which each of the two features above is useful to man
answer:
(a)(i) River Capture: This is also called river piracy or river beheading. It results when a river through head water of erosion into a water divide cuts up the headwater of another but a weaker river. The river pirated is called misfit and the point of capture is called elbow of capture The valley below the elbow is called wind gap. 

(i) Waterfall: This is formed as a result of unequal resistance of hard and soft rocks transverse by a river. The out crop of a band of hard rock may cause a river to fall downstream in greater dimension from some heights called waterfall 

(b) One way in which river capture is useful to man is channelization of water away from settlements while waterfall is useful for the generation of hydro-electric power

question:
(a) Distinguish between an ecosystem and a food chain

(b) Explain the interdependence of the biotic and abiotic components of the environment
answer:
(a) Ecosystem; is defined as the relationship between the living things and the non-living things in a community. The living things are referred to as the biotic factors while the non-living things are the abiotic factors. Examples of biotic factors are plants and animals which can be producers or consumers, while the abiotic factors include temperature, wind, rainfall, sunlight, etc. Food chain refers to the linear feeding relationships among certain species of a community. Food chain can lead to energy transfer from one organism to another. Examples of a food chain is

Grass →Grasshoppers →Toads→ Hawks
Grass is the producer while grasshopper, toad and hawks are consumers 

(b) The interdependence of the biotic and abiotic components of the environment; 

(i) Plants (biotic) depend on oxygen (abiotic) for respiration

(ii) Plants (biotic) also depend on carbon dioxide (non biotic) for photosynthesis

(iii) Plants (biotic) also depend on water (abiotic) for nutrition and other uses

(iv) Plants also require sunlight for photosynthesis

(v) Abiotic factors like oxygen, carbon dioxide are produced by plants and animals during photosynthesis and respiration respectively.

question:
Write explanatory notes on each of the following
(a) deforestation
(b) drought
answer:
(a) Deforestation: This is the process of cutting down trees or forest for the purpose of farming, lumbering, mining, grazing, etc without immediate replanting of trees.

Effects of deforestation include:

(i) It exposes the soil to rain and wind erosion

(ii) It destroys the natural forest which is rich in natural resources

(iii) It could lead to flooding and desertification.

Control include

(i) Afforestation: which is the planting of new trees

(ii)Avoiding over-grazing

(iii)Avoiding indiscriminate bush burning

(iv) Use of forest guards.

(b) Drought: This is also called dryness. It occurs when there is-no rainfall or when it is inadequate with increase in temperature. It causes heat and dusty environment, poor yield of crops and desert encroachment. Control is by irrigation, mulching of the ground to conserve water, planting of trees, creation of shelter belts, etc

question:
(a) Explain the term migration and describe any three forms it may take

(b) State any four factors that may be responsible for migration

(c) Outline any three advantages and three disadvantages of any one type of migration mentioned in (a) above.
answer:
(a) Migration is the movement of people from one geographical area tc another involving permanent or temporary settlement.

Three forms of migration are:

(i) Rural-Urban migration

(ii) Urban-Rural migration

(iii) Urban-Urban migration

(b) Four factors that may be responsible for migration include:

(i) Physical conditions like climate, relief, etc

(ii) Natural disasters like famine, floods, etc

(iii) Insecurity e.g war

(iv) Differences in the availability of social amenities

(c) Three advantages or Rural-Urban Migration:

(i) reduced population pressure on agricultural lands

(ii) Supply of migrant labour

(iii) Promotion of cultural integration.

Three disadvantages of Rural-Urban Migration:

(i) It leads to unemployment

(ii) It leads to high cost of living

(iii) There is pressure on social amenities.

question:

answer:

(b) The characteristic features of manufacturing industries in tropical African countries:

(i) Importation of skilled labour

(ii) Imported raw materials

(iii)They are labour intensive

(iv) They are largely small-scaled

(v) The industries are concentrated in few locations

(c) Four reasons why countries embark on industrialization include:

question: Compare and contrast the trade relations between Nigeria and the United Kingdom with that between Nigeria and Japan
answer:
(a) Trade between Nigeria and United Kingdom and that between Nigeria and Japan.

Similarities:
(i) There is importation of finished products from both countries

(ii) There is export of primary products to both countries

(iii) There is importation of skilled labour from both countries

(iv) There is importation of technology from both countries.

Differences:
(i) There is older trade relationship with U.K than Japan

(ii) There is greater volume of trade with the U.K

(iii) Exportation of crude oil to Japan and none to U.K

(iv) Importation of finished goods to Nigeria from Japan than U.K

question:

(b) How can the problems be solved?
answer:
(a) Five problems of development in the Niger Delta region include:

(i) Problem of soil erosion to environment

(ii) Oil pollution and oil spillage are major problems

(iii) High level of salt inhibits agriculture

(iv) There is poor water transportation development

(v) It has a very low population.

(b) Solutions to the problems include:

(i) Floods and erosion should be controlled

(ii) Adequate care should be taken to avoid oil spillage on water

(iii) The land should be reclaimed from marshy areas

(iv) Flyovers should be constructed

(iv) Provision of basic amenities for the people

question:

(a) Five distinguishing features of plantation agriculture in East Africa are:

(i) It involves the growing of one crop on the same piece of land

(ii) A large area of land in required

(iii) It requires high capital investment

(iv) Cash crops are mainly involved

(v)All farm operations are mechanized

(b) Five factors which have favoured the practice of plantation agriculture in East Africa include:
(i) Favourable climate
(ii) Rich fertile soils
(iii) High demands for crops (market)
(iv) Availability of cheap labour
(v) Good transportation system
